title: The Wall, ICE & more: How Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' could change US immigration system
content: Donald Trump's "Big, Beautiful Bill" proposes $150 billion for mass deportations over four years, dwarfing ICE's current budget. The House has approved key immigration sections, with the Senate debating a similar version. The bill allocates significant funds for the border wall, detention facilities, increased ICE staff, and overhauling immigration courts, alongside dramatic fee hikes for immigration services.

title: Russia says remaining two S-400 squadrons will be delivered by 2026-27
content: Russia has assured India that the remaining two squadrons of the S-400 Triumf missile systems will be delivered by 2026-27, despite delays caused by the Russia-Ukraine war. These systems played a crucial role during Operation Sindoor against Pakistan last month. India is also developing its own air defence system, Project Kusha, with operational deployment planned for 2028-2029.

title: Khamenei says Iran ‘delivered a hard slap’ to US; plays down strike impact on nuclear sites
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in his first address since the ceasefire, sharply criticized the United States for its direct involvement in the recent conflict, including strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Khamenei claimed Iran emerged victorious, delivering a "hard slap" to America, and dismissed President Trump's actions as mere "showmanship.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-India bowler slams Jadeja - 'He bowled either too short or ...'
content: Varun Aaron has criticized Ravindra Jadeja's performance in the first Test against England, highlighting his inability to exploit the rough patches on the fifth-day pitch. Aaron noted Jadeja's inconsistent bowling length and speed, which allowed England's batters, particularly Ben Duckett, to disrupt his rhythm. He emphasized that Jadeja's experience should have enabled him to secure a historic victory for India.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: 'Wapas track pe aaja': Prithvi Shaw recalls Sachin Tendulkar's advice
content: Prithvi Shaw, once a celebrated cricket prodigy, faced setbacks after early success. He lost focus and was dropped from teams. Sachin Tendulkar's support motivated Shaw to turn things around. Now, at 25, Shaw joined Maharashtra cricket to rebuild his career. He acknowledges his past mistakes and is working hard. Shaw aims for redemption with Sachin's backing.

title: US Embassy warns: Missing info on visa form can get you rejected; Applicants must list all…
content: The US Embassy in India has cautioned visa seekers to accurately disclose their social media presence. Failing to list all usernames and handles used across various platforms in the last five years on the DS-160 form could result in visa denial and future ineligibility.

title: 'Jai Hind, Jai Bharat': Shubhanshu Shukla's first message to India from ISS
content: Shubhanshu Shukla, an Axiom-4 crew member, has reached the International Space Station, marking a significant milestone for India's space program. He expressed his excitement about participating in scientific experiments over the next 14 days and conveyed his gratitude to the ISS crew for their warm welcome.

title: 'Like BJP stooge': Mamata claims ECI covertly introducing NRC in Bengal
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of acting as a BJP stooge, alleging a backdoor attempt to implement the NRC through special electoral roll revisions. Banerjee claims the ECI is seeking extensive documentation, including parents' birth certificates, from voters born between specific dates, calling it a scam.

title: Amazon employees to CEO: 'Nothing more motivating on a Tuesday than...'
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy warned corporate employees about upcoming workforce reductions due to AI-driven "efficiency gains." This announcement sparked internal backlash, with employees expressing concerns about job displacement and over-reliance on AI. Jassy envisions a future dominated by AI agents, but workers question the impact on leadership and the reliability of these systems.

title: Bill Belichick breaks silence as Robert Kraft puts full power behind Mike Vrabel’s takeover
content: New England Patriots fans are optimistic as owner Robert Kraft and former coach Bill Belichick commend new head coach Mike Vrabel. Kraft promises a turnaround after disappointing seasons, highlighting Vrabel's connection with players and rebuild plan. Belichick praises Vrabel's leadership and bravery, fueling hope for a return to winning ways as training camp approaches.

title: What is China's mosquito drone? Capable of capturing images, audio & electronic signals
content: China has unveiled a mosquito-sized drone developed by the National University of Defense Technology, raising concerns about its potential for espionage and military applications. The ultra-light robot, equipped with cameras and microphones, can operate silently and evade detection, making it ideal for indoor surveillance and reconnaissance.

title: ‘Very normal’: Pakistan confirms China sharing intel on India after Op Sindoor
content: Khawaja Asif, Pakistan's defence minister, stated that China shared intelligence on India with Pakistan. This sharing occurred after Operation Sindoor and increased tensions. Asif mentioned that friendly countries commonly exchange intelligence. Pakistan has been on high alert since a recent conflict with India. A ceasefire is in place, and both countries hope for continued calm.

title: 'I can’t afford to pay': Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union on financial strain
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Indian team in US for fresh talks on trade deal
content: Indian officials are in the US, led by chief negotiator Rajesh Agarwal, for trade deal talks aimed at bridging differences. Agriculture is a key sticking point, with India hesitant to lower tariffs on sensitive items like maize and soybean due to the prevalence of genetically modified crops in the US.

title: Dylan Harper drafted by Spurs: NBA champ Ron Harper is his dad; meet mom Maria Harper
content: Dylan Harper, son of Rutgers star Maria Harper and NBA legend Ron Harper, was recently drafted by the San Antonio Spurs. Growing up in a basketball-oriented family, both parents played a crucial role in shaping his career. His mother coached him from elementary school, while his father, a former Chicago Bulls and Lakers player, provided inspiration.

title: Two states, two wives, same plot: How husbands were killed in 'similar' manner, miles apart
content: In chilling echoes of betrayal, two honeymoon murders have rocked India. In Telangana, a land surveyor was allegedly killed at his wife's lover's behest after she shared his location. Similarly, in Meghalaya, a newlywed was murdered on his honeymoon, with his wife accused of paying her lover to orchestrate the killing.

title: Brutal! 'We could've chased even 450': England batter over the moon after 1st Test victory
content: England's Jos Buttler and Stuart Broad looked into England's stunning chase against India at Headingley, suggesting they could have surpassed an even larger target than 371. Buttler emphasized England's aggressive approach, stating they would have pursued even 450.

title: 'Apologise to Biharis': PK's 'bada bada gyan' swipe at Rahul Gandhi
content: Bihar is gearing up for assembly elections. Prashant Kishor criticises Rahul Gandhi's engagement with the state. He challenges Gandhi to spend a night in a Bihar village. Kishor also demands an apology from Revanth Reddy for remarks about Biharis. He questions Congress's contributions to Bihar's development. The political landscape is heating up with accusations and counter-accusations.

title: Done deal! Ronaldo shuts down transfer rumors, signs two-year contract extension
content: Cristiano Ronaldo has extended his contract with Al Nassr until 2027, committing his future to the Saudi Arabian club. His arrival in 2023 spurred a wave of established players moving to the Saudi Pro League. Despite being the league's top scorer, Ronaldo is yet to win a title with Al Nassr.

title: ‘One particular country objected’: MEA on why Rajnath refused to sign SCO statement
content: India declined to endorse the joint statement at the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in Qingdao due to the omission of its terrorism concerns. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh insisted on acknowledging the Pahalgam attack, attributed to Lashkar-e-Taiba, while the statement referenced activities in Balochistan. Consensus eluded the member states, leading to the abandonment of the joint statement.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Paaji, Paaji!' and the hunt for a Birmingham bounceback
content: In Birmingham, the Indian cricket team seeks comfort amidst a series loss, finding familiarity in the city's "desi" atmosphere. Despite a strong performance in the first Test, India faces pressure to regroup, with young players needing to step up. The team emphasises camaraderie and a positive dressing room environment to fuel their performance in the upcoming Birmingham Test.

title: IND vs ENG: England handed massive boost; 150+ kmph pacer joins squad
content: A 30-year-old pacer is all set to make a sensational return to England's Test squad after more than four years, boosting their pace attack for the second Test against India. His inclusion aims to strengthen England's lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, following their impressive win in the first Test at Headingley.

title: Rs 1 'Pulse' candy: How DS Group aims to make it a Rs 1,000 cr brand
content: Homegrown FMCG firm Dharampal Satyapal Group's Pulse candy is poised to become a Rs 1,000-crore brand within two years, projecting its current sales. Having already crossed Rs 750 crore in FY25, the company plans strategic expansion into adjacent product categories and innovative formats.

title: Operation Bihali: 1 Jaish terrorist killed in J&K's Udhampur, 3 others trapped
content: In a joint operation in Basantgarh, the Indian army and Jammu and Kashmir police neutralized a terrorist. Operation Bihali was launched based on intelligence inputs, leading to the encirclement of four Jaish-e-Mohammad militants who were under surveillance for a year. Despite challenging weather conditions, security forces continue search operations to neutralize the remaining terrorists.

title: India vs England Tests: Will he, won't he? The Jasprit Bumrah dilemma!
content: The Indian cricket team faces a crucial decision regarding Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the upcoming Test matches against England. Bumrah is slated to play only three Tests. Team management must decide whether he will play in Birmingham or Lord's. A decision to rest Bumrah will necessitate a replacement. Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav are potential candidates.

title: NHL trade rumors: Rangers could move K’Andre Miller to land $56 mn defenseman
content: The New York Rangers are linked to LA Kings defenseman Vladislav Gavrikov ahead of NHL free agency. Coming off a +26 season with 30 points, Gavrikov is a top shutdown defenseman target. With his projected $56 million contract, the Rangers may need to trade K’Andre Miller to create cap space and upgrade their blue line.

title: Donald Trump’s tariff wars deal a blow! US economy shrinks 0.5%; worse than estimates
content: The US economy contracted by 0.5% in the first quarter of 2025, primarily due to a surge in imports spurred by President Trump's trade war. This import surge, up 37.9%, significantly dragged down GDP, marking the first quarterly decline in three years. Despite the downturn, economists anticipate a rebound in the second quarter, projecting a 3% growth.

title: 'Life very alluring': Why SC rejected doctors’ plea against transfer from Bengaluru
content: The Supreme Court refused to entertain a plea by government doctors challenging their transfer orders from Bengaluru, stating the city's allure isn't grounds to resist relocation. Justices noted no prejudice was caused by the transfers. The doctors contested the Karnataka State Civil Services rules governing medical personnel transfers, arguing inadequate time was given to object to the draft rules.

title: How Shubhanshu Shukla scripted history and made India proud
content: The Dragon capsule 'Grace,' carrying the Axiom-4 crew, successfully docked with the International Space Station, marking a historic moment as Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla became the first Indian to enter the orbiting lab. Launched from Kennedy Space Center, the mission signifies a maturing space ecosystem with private firms shaping access to low-Earth orbit.

title: 'Treat on merit’: MEA flags concerns over new social media rules for US visa
content: The Ministry of External Affairs says the US should assess Indian visa applications fairly. This follows the US embassy's new guidelines. Applicants must now share social media details. Omitting information may lead to visa denial. The US embassy in India also asks student visa applicants to make social media accounts public.

title: India tour of England diaries: KL Rahul travels with his mattress; coaches' evening stroll
content: The Indian cricket team travelled to Birmingham from Leeds on June 25 for their next Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy match. KL Rahul's personal mattress highlighted players' preference for comfortable sleep. Head coach Gautam Gambhir and batting coach Sitanshu Kotak were seen exploring the city. Coffee runs and senior players mentoring youngsters marked their downtime, with training possibly resuming on Friday.

title: Exclusive| 'Country over my child': KL Rahul's first words before England Tests
content: KL Rahul prioritised national duty, choosing to prepare for the England Test series soon after becoming a father. He aimed to lead the team in the absence of senior players. Rahul's commitment was evident as he played an unofficial Test, scoring a century. He opened alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal and scored another century in the first Test.

title: NFL vs. NBA player salaries: Who earns more?
content: In American sports, NBA players earn significantly more than NFL players. The average NBA salary is about $11.91 million, much higher than the NFL's $2.8 to $3.2 million. Smaller NBA rosters and revenue distribution favor basketball. NBA stars like Stephen Curry earn huge amounts. The NFL's larger teams and shorter careers contribute to lower pay. The NBA's global appeal boosts player earnings.

title: Exclusive: No Magnus Carlsen in India! Freestyle Chess event called off over lack of sponsors
content: The Indian leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, scheduled for September in New Delhi, has been cancelled due to a lack of sponsors. This is a disappointment for fans hoping to see Magnus Carlsen compete in India. CEO Jan Henric Buettner confirmed the move and will step down in July. The next event is in Las Vegas this July.

title: A famous dad, the perfect swing and elite Fortnite skills: Meet MLB's most fascinating hitter
content: The A's star is a former first-round pick and the son of a major leaguer, but the secret to his success starts with a video game controller.

title: Ex-Ravens PK Tucker gets 10-week suspension
content: Former Ravens kicker Justin Tucker has been suspended for the first 10 weeks of the 2025 regular season after the NFL found that he violated its personal conduct policy.

title: Sources: Team in top five told not to pick Bailey
content: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing, and that he wouldn't report if they did, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: NHL, NHLPA close to 4-yr. CBA extension
content: The NHL and NHLPA are in the final stages of agreeing to a four-year extension of the CBA through September 2030, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Bengals take major step toward extending lease
content: The Bengals and local officials have reached a tentative deal to make $470 million in renovations to Paycor Stadium and keep the team there for at least the next 11 years.

title: Haaland outpaces Messi, Mbappé to 300 goals
content: Erling Haaland scored the 300th goal of his career for club and country as Manchester City defeated Juventus at the Club World Cup.

title: WSOP probes possible Millionaire Maker collusion
content: The World Series of Poker is investigating the winner and runner-up in its $1,500 Millionaire Maker event that concluded Wednesday.

title: SB LIX performer arrested for halftime protest
content: A performer at Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl halftime show in February has been arrested after holding up a Sudanese flag there with the message "Sudan and Free Gaza."

title: Kipyegon's bid for sub-4-minute mile falls short
content: Faith Kipyegon, a three-time Olympic champion, came up short in her bid to become the first woman to run a mile in under four minutes, posting a time of 4 minutes, 06.42 seconds at Stade Charléty in Paris on Thursday.

title: Updated Round 2 mock draft: Teams are trading picks ahead of night two of the 2025 NBA draft
content: Who are the best players still on the board -- and where could they go? We project the draft's next 29 picks.

title: Final moves for every NFL team: Landing spots for 11 free agents, plus two trades that should be made
content: Which signings, trades and extensions should still happen this offseason? We suggested one final move for every NFL team as we near training camp.

title: Final 2025 NHL mock draft: Predictions for the top 32 picks
content: While the top two picks appear to be locked in, what happens after that? Here's the final projection before Friday's first round.

title: NHL draft buzz: Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Four big questions: Will there finally be a repeat champ? What’s at stake for the QBs?
content: History would indicate the Eagles won't repeat, so who else in the NFC East stands a chance to win the division?

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Andreas Hale talks to Jake Paul, his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: Cooper Flagg, Derik Queen and other Montverde Academy stars' NBA path
content: Four of the Florida high school's Class of 2024 starting five were selected as first-rounders in this year's draft.

title: Nonstatistical superlatives: Biggest moments and best vibes
content: From eye-catching outfits to heartwarming moments, here are our favorite nonstatistical superlatives from the NBA draft.

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Taylor Swift joins Kane Brown in surprise performance
content: Taylor Swift performs 'Shake It Off' and walks the red carpet with Travis Kelce at Tight End University.

title: How Elite 11 changed the ESPN 300 QB rankings
content: Following the summer camp circuit, the newest rankings have some big changes for the class's signal-callers.

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the Gold Cup group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that. These five questions need answers ASAP.

title: Wrexham to open Ch'ship season at Southampton
content: Wrexham will begin their first Championship campaign in over 40 years away at former Premier League side Southampton, before a tough run in their first five.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M
content: Liverpool have completed the signing of Bournemouth left-back Milos Kerkez, the Premier League champions have announced.

title: Arsenal starlet Lewis-Skelly signs long-term deal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly has signed a new long-term contract at Arsenal, the Premier League club confirmed on Thursday.

title: Barça chief Laporta: Madrid have model of 'power'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta has said Clásico rivals Real Madrid have a model of "power" and "signing players" that contrasts with how the Catalan club is run.

title: Éderson shuts down exit talk; to remain at Man City
content: Éderson has committed his future to Manchester City and insists he intends to stay at the Etihad Stadium next season.

title: Otamendi: 'I don't see Messi missing World Cup'
content: Benfica defender Nicolás Otamendi has said he doesn't expect Argentina teammate Lionel Messi to miss the 2026 World Cup.

title: Xabi calls on Vini, Mbappé to 'improve' off the ball
content: Xabi Alonso called on Real Madrid stars like Vinícius Júnior and Kylian Mbappé to "improve" their off-the-ball work-rate ahead of the team's final Club World Cup group game with Salzburg.

title: Argentina 2nd tier player, 18, dies during surgery
content: Camilo Nuin, an 18-year-old player for Argentina second division team San Telmo, died on Wednesday during knee surgery.

title: Meet the favorites, sleepers and spoilers of NASCAR's first in-season tournament
content: Whether you're a weekly watcher or a casual Cup fan, this guide will get you up to speed on the drivers in the bracket.

title: Which rookies should you roster in 2025-26?
content: Andre Snellings looks at what fantasy managers can expect from Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper, Ace Bailey and other touted rookies in fantasy basketball next season.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 5: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: Jaipur Man Arrested For Raping Two Daughters For 5 Years: Cops
content: A man was arrested and sent to jail on Thursday for raping two minor daughters for about five years, a senior police official said.

title: What Iran's Khamenei Said On Trump's "Surrender" Remark
content: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has strongly criticised US President Donald Trump's call for Iran's surrender, describing it as "too big to come out of his mouth."

title: Iran Says No Plan For New US Nuclear Talks
content: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on Wednesday firmly denied speculation Iran is preparing to resume nuclear negotiations with the United States, after the end of a 12-day war with Israel.

title: "People Target Me Because They Know I Am Next Lalu Yadav": Tej Pratap To NDTV
content: Expelled from the Rashtriya Janata Dal for six years, with the announcement coming from none other than his father, Tej Pratap Yadav has claimed people are conspiring against him because they know that he is the next Lalu Yadav.

title: "Dangerous": Congress Slams Poll Body's Intensive Revision Of Electoral Rolls In Bihar
content: The Congress party has strongly opposed the Election Commission of India's decision to undertake a Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar ahead of the upcoming 2025 Assembly elections.

title: Humble Beginnings To Serving Nation: Assam Rifles Felicitates 9 Newly Commissioned Officers From Manipur
content: In an event exemplifying the contributions of Manipur towards the armed forces, the Assam Rifles on Wednesday felicitated nine officers who have been recently commissioned into the Indian Army, Indian Air Force (IAF) and Assam Rifles, officials said.

title: Developed Or Upper-Middle Income? Top Economist Visualises India At 2047
content: The goal of making India a developed country by 2047 is "plausible" if the economy stays to the current growth rate of 6 per cent, economist Martin Wolf told NDTV in an exclusive interview on Thursday.

title: Have Noted That US Has Updated Travel Advisory For India: Foreign Ministry
content: MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said this in response to a query on the advisory issued recently by the US for its citizens travelling to India.

title: After Op Sindoor Success, Indian Drone Startup Raises Massive $100 Million
content: UAV manufacturing startup Raphe mPhibr, whose drones participated in Operation Sindoor, has raised $100 million in a funding round led by General Catalyst.

title: Vessels Near Strait Of Hormuz Transmit Unusual Messages To Prevent Attacks
content: U.S. President Donald Trump brokered a ceasefire after 12 days of war but the maritime threat remains elevated, the Joint Maritime Information Center (JMIC) said.

title: Anna Wintour Steps Down As Editor Of US Vogue After Nearly 40 Years: Report
content: Magazine legend Anna Wintour is stepping down as editor of fashion bible US Vogue after 37 years in the post, US media reported.

title: Donald Trump Defends US Strikes On Iran, Says Nuclear Facilities "Fully Obliterated"
content: President Donald Trump on Wednesday rejected an early intelligence assessment that U.S. strikes inflicted only a marginal setback on Iran's nuclear program, insisting that his country's spies did not have the full picture.

title: Should Treat Visa Applications On Merit: India On US Social Media Scrutiny
content: The US Embassy in India, in a social post had asked Indian students to list all social media usernames or handles of every platform they have used in the last five years on their application form.

title: Gurugram Man Falls Asleep While Driving, Rams Law Student And His Friend, Arrested
content: A law student died and his friend was critically injured after a speeding car hit them in Gurugram. It was later found that the driver, now arrested, had fallen asleep behind the wheel.

title: UP Man Beaten To Death, Cop Suspended For Negligence After Video Goes Viral
content: A Station House Officer in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria district was suspended on Thursday for alleged negligence in handling the case of a man who was beaten to death in the Rudrapur area earlier this month, police said.

title: Nepal Government In Minority After Key Party Withdraws Support In Upper House
content: A key Madhesi party in Nepal has formally withdrawn support to Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli-led ruling coalition, reducing it to a minority in the National Assembly.

title: New India Assurance Gets GST Demand Notice Of Nearly Rs 2,300 Crore
content: New India Assurance Company Ltd on Thursday said tax authorities have issued a show cause notice with a demand of Rs 2,298 crore Goods and Services Tax (GST) for five financial years.

title: Odisha's Puri "Fully Prepared" For Rath Yatra, Administration On High Alert
content: The seaside pilgrim town of Puri is set to celebrate the Rath Yatra festival on Friday, with the administration being ready to smoothly conduct the event.

title: US Shares Test Footage Of Bunker Busters To Prove Damage In Iran Strikes
content: They played videos of how the bombing took place on the nuclear sites, explaining how the bombers attacked. Unlike other normal bombs, the damage done by a bunker-buster bomb, cannot be seen on the surface level.

title: Pickaxe Mountain, Site Near Natanz Facility, May Be Hiding Iran's Uranium
content: The site, located near the Natanz nuclear facility, has drawn renewed attention after satellite images revealed a fortified tunnel system and expanded security perimeter.

title: Decision on India’s 2036 Olympic Games bid set to take longer than expected
content: International Olympic Committee President Kirsty Coventry announces pause in 2036 Olympics bid decision and sets up working group for future host selection

title: Congress opposes special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar
content: The party says the move will lead to “huge risk of wilful exclusion of voters using the power of the State machinery”

title: Issue birth certificate before discharge of baby, Registrar General of India tells States
content: The Registrar General office says the registrar should give the birth certificate as soon as the registration of birth is completed “but not later than seven days” in an electronic or other format

title: Ernakulam DDMA holds emergency meeting
content: The meeting, chaired by the District Collector and attended by representatives of various departments, reviewed the precautionary measures in place

title: Moolampilly package: Revenue minister petitioned over delay in implementing monitoring panel decisions
content: The petition was submitted to mark the anniversary of the last meeting of the monitoring committee chaired by the District Collector on June 27, 2024

title: Demolition of Chander Kunj apartments: owners to take a call on legal recourse
content: The petitioners had filed the review petitions seeking clarity on various aspects of the original verdict

title: ‘Drug money’: Majithia sent to 7-day remand; Mann warns of more arrests
content: Court to review remand on July 2; Punjab Chief Minister claims political nexus shielding drug smugglers, says 29 phones, 8 laptops seized in drug-linked laundering case; SAD accuses AAP govt. of political vendetta and bypassing due legal process

title: No great work has ever been created under influence of drugs, says Prithviraj Sukumaran
content: The ‘No Entry’ campaign proposes a strong declaration by the individual and society in general in a collective resistance against drugs

title: Search continues for man missing in Pooyamkutty river
content: Five teams — one from the Indian Navy, two from the National Disaster Response Force, and two scuba teams from the Fire and Rescue Services — resumed the search around 7.30 a.m.

title: Willing to discuss ongoing issues with Bangladesh: India
content: The Ministry of External Affairs’ remarks come a day before the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs holds a special meeting on Bangladesh with four experts

title: Slew of events mark International Day Against Drug Abuse in Kochi
content: A cross-section of society — including health workers, senior citizens, students, parents, teachers, and officials from various government departments — benefited from the sessions

title: Crimes against women, Dalits dampen Majhi govt.’s one-year celebrations
content: Since the so-called ‘double-engine’ government came to power, law and order in Odisha has collapsed, says Congress Legislature Party leader Rama Chandra Kadam

title: Traffic police gear up for crackdown on non-HSRP vehicles in Hyderabad
content: While challans are being issued under the ‘irregular number plate’ category, enforcement has not been systematic and uniform, said a senior traffic police official from Cyberabad

title: Prashanth Hospitals completes 500 robotic knee surgeries using 4th Gen Velys system
content: The velys robotic-assisted solution, particularly the 4th generation, is a robotic system designed to assist surgeons in total knee replacement surgeries

title: Schools can take time to use mother tongue as medium: CBSE officials
content: CBSE Chairman aims to ease the implementation of the National Education Policy; officials admitted that the board’s recent recommendation would be challenging for schools with students from different mother tongues

title: Devotees participate in ‘Aashada Saare’ ritual at Indrakeeladri
content: Large number of devotees from across the State participated in the event, receiving free prasadam and blessings from the priests

title: Businessline conclave in Coimbatore to focus on MSMEs’ contribution to Indian growth story
content: With a vast network comprising approximately 6.3 crore MSMEs, this sector generates employment opportunities for around 11 crore people

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United explore Zaïre-Emery move
content: Manchester United are looking to make an ambitious move for PSG midfielder Warren Zaïre-Emery. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: CBFC revising committee rejects certification to JSK - Janaki vs State of Kerala
content: Filmmakers asked change the title of the film as well as the name of the protagonist, Janaki, another name of Hindu goddess Sita

title: Protests erupt in Etawah over FIR against Yadav religious narrators
content: Tension escalates as police fire in air to disperse crowd; Akhilesh Yadav demands for fair investigation and action

title: ‘Secularism’ and ‘socialism’ not part of Preamble drafted by Ambedkar, must be reviewed: RSS
content: RSS general secretary asks Congress to apologise to the nation for the Emergency; says ‘secularism’ and ‘socialism’ were inserted into the Preamble during a time when citizens’ rights were suspended

title: Allahabad HC expresses anguish over burden of live-in relationship cases
content: Bench observes that the concept of live-in relationships is against the “settled law in the Indian middle-class society”

title: ‘Fake spirituality’ of BJP will not work in Tamil Nadu, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: He asserts that the BJP and its allies in the State are more concerned about religion than the dip in national economic growth and unemployment

title: Will never give up Anna for he is in our blood, says Palaniswami
content: In his first assurance to the people for the 2026 Assembly election, the AIADMK general secretary vows to restore T.N.’s rights which, he alleges, were given up by the DMK government

title: Centre to set up high-level panel to examine displacement concerns in Rourkela rail project
content: Committee to address rehabilitation, employment for locals affected by steel plant railway line doubling

title: Staggered polls cannot be considered an immutable feature of Constitution: ex-CJI Chandrachud
content: Sources said that, in a written submission to a Parliamentary Joint Committee, the former CJI dismisses fears that the Bills will imperil federalist structure; says Indian electorate is not “naive”

title: Governor-government row over ‘Bharat Mata’ assumes a combative dimension
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan notifies Raj Bhavan that only Constitutionally mandated national symbols were permissible at functions attended by the Governor. Raj Bhavan lodges a formal objection to General Education Minister V Sivankutty’s “protocol-breaching boycott” of an official event attended by the Governor, citing the placement of the ‘Bharat Mata’ motif at the venue

title: Kolhapuri chappal makers cry foul over Prada’s ‘replica’ sandal
content: Artisans allege cultural appropriation and GI violation; seek legal action and formal recognition from the fashion brand

title: Farmers’ outfits vow to put up united fight against ‘trade agreements that hurt agriculture, industry’ with U.S., U.K.
content: The SKM has urged PM Modi to table to draft proposals on such agreements in Parliament and hold discussions with State governments and farmers’ and workers’ organisations on them

title: Kerala has done pioneering work in taking up digital land survey: Manoj Joshi
content: He lauds integration of registration system and land records in two villages in the State on a pilot basis to avoid delays

title: Opposition in Bihar raises questions over special revision of voters’ list
content: Congress and RJD alleged that there was a conspiracy to remove the names of the youth, Dalits, poor and minorities from the voters’ list before the Assembly election

title: Integrated Bus Terminus in Tiruchi yet to become fully operational even six weeks after CM inaugurating it
content: Officials say efforts on to get the traders open the shops to ensure availability of snacks and beverages for the commuters; maintenance of the terminus was being outsourced and tenders were likely to be opened on June 30 to finalise contractors

title: Centre calls for proposals to set up regional centres for senior citizen care
content: These centres will be responsible for running training and awareness programmes in the States assigned to them and are mandated to provide technical expertise in preparing State-level action plans. This comes even as the Centre is in the final stages of preparing a new national policy on senior citizens

title: Youth killed, mother injured in accident on MG Road in Thrissur
content: A private bus hit the scooter as the rider swerved to avoid a pothole; Opposition demands homicide case against the Mayor

title: Despite high cancer awareness, survey reveals gaps in its prevention and screening in Kerala
content: In a survey of 2,443 individuals, close to 90% respondents recognised smoking as a causative factor for cancer and nearly 73% acknowledged the role of alcohol consumption in aggravating cancer risk.

title: Majithia sent to seven-day vigilance remand in drug-linked money laundering case
content: Chief Minister says ‘big fish’ in drug trade to face action; Shiromani Akali Dal alleges political vendetta

title: Corruption allegations against BJP councillors roil Thiruvananthapuram Corporation council meeting
content: Councillors of rival parties nearly came to blows on more than one occasion in a tense meeting in which no other agenda was discussed

title: Rise in C-section deliveries: Audit finds lack of confidence among specialists and sub-optimal capacity of labour room staff main contributing factors
content: In Karnataka, nearly one in every three deliveries is conducted through a C-section. Over the past 15 years, the C-section rate has doubled, indicating a significant shift in obstetric practices

title: Kerala tops the Management Effectiveness Evaluation of national parks and protected areas
content: Kerala is the only State to get a “Very Good” rating with a score of 76.22%. Karnataka (74.24), Punjab (71.74), and Himachal Pradesh (71.36) came next with “Good” rating.

title: Coimbatore MSMEs see orders moving to other districts, States
content: “While 60 % of the orders from pumpset companies have gone to Gujarat; orders from the automobile sector is going to multiple centres such as Hosur and Chennai”

title: Construction of overhead water tank in Konidela commences
content: Tenders finalised, while the Rural Water Supply department has been asked to ensure that the works are done properly, says Nandyal Collector

title: Two parallel compensations at work for domestic, international services in case of airline accidents in the country
content: The revised Montreal Convention Compensation Limits was not adopted by India. The 1999 Montreal Convention establishes a uniform global liability standard that applies equally to domestic and international airline operations worldwide

title: Congress questions bail granted to two people arrested on charges of manipulating NEET marks
content: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar questions CBI claim that no NTA officials were involved, noting that the accused were arrested under the Anti-Corruption Act; asks if big scam is possible without official connivance

title: Seeds for space: Green gram and fenugreek from Dharwad sent to ISS for experiment
content: This research is aimed at contributing towards the development of India-centric salad vegetable for astronaut nourishment in space

title: Currency scam gang busted in Sullurpeta
content: Police seize ₹73.2 lakh cash, fake notes in the denomination of ₹2,000, six Wi-Fi mobile routers, two SUVs and five mobile phones from the accused

title: Heavy rain lashes Idukki
content: Highest rainfall of 148.11 mm recorded in Peerumade taluk. Officials say 250 mm rainfall was recorded at a rain gauge installed at Bison Valley, a private plantation

title: CMO directs Health department to frame guidelines for safe child births
content: Due to lack of awareness, many migrant families are continuing to opt for home births, risking the lives of both the mothers and newborns, says a medical officer

title: Ensure Governor functions with Constitutional limits, Venugopal writes to President
content: Says the insistence by the Governor’s office on displaying the image of ‘Bharat Mata’ holding a saffron flag at official functions, an emblem that holds no Constitutional or statutory recognition, has created avoidable friction

title: ISKCON’s Jagannath Rath Yatra in Vijayawada on Friday
content: The three-day spiritual event will feature grand processions, cultural performances, and devotional festivities and see participation of devotees from India and abroad, say organisers

title: College Football 26 gameplay deep dive details improvements
content: college football 26's wear and tear system allows players to swap athletes in and out without having to pause the game . users can tone down the damage of tackles or speed up recovery times . the system will not only have gameplay implications by lowering the performance .

title: Experts' picks, best bets: Who should bettors back at UFC 317?
content: the main event will feature former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria taking on former lightweight titleholder Charles Oliveira . the 155-pound belt recently vacated by Islam Makhachev has not lost since July 2020 . Alexandre Pantoja returns to the Octagon seeking his fourth consecutive men's flyweight title defense against Kai Kara-France .

title: Trade grades: Mammoth get an A+ for Peterka addition

title: Best picks, surprising moves, top trades from Round 1
content: a round 1 of the 2025 draft on Wednesday began with Cooper Flagg . the first of three Duke players selected was drafted by the Dallas Mavericks with the no. 1 pick . there were winners and surprises, such as the Utah Jazz .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: noggets president Josh Kroenke explains a scenario in which the team could end up trading Nikola Jokic under the second apron . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster .

title: NBA trade tracker: Live updates during the 2025 draft
content: the 2025 offseason is here, and deals are getting done . on the last day of the season, the Phoenix Suns traded MVP Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets for Jalen Green and Dillon Brooks . the grizzlies moved guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for a package of players and draft picks while the Eastern Conference champion Indiana Pacers reacquired their 2026 first-round pick .

title: Bradley's take: Will Paul's hook land better than Julio César Chávez Jr.'s?
content: a 10-round cruiserweight bout against former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. will be his 13th pro fight of 2025 . this will be Paul's first pro fight against a former boxing champ other than last November's fight against the then 58-year-old Mike Tyson . Chavez has fought only once since 2021 .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Bueckers, then who? Ranking the 8 best rookies in the WNBA this season
content: a handful of young players in this electric rookie class are having unexpected breakouts . this group includes recent college graduates and players signed from overseas . a general manager told ESPN that Bueckers could "impact the league immediately" and "be dangerous right away"
